FuncDef:
The access-line-id parse-mode command configures the format of access-line-id information.
The undo access-line-id parse-mode command restores the default setting.
The option-82 parse-mode command configures the format of access-line-id information.
The undo option-82 parse-mode command restores the default setting.
By default, the parsing mode to access-line-id information is not configured,the parsing mode of access-line-id information is cn.
CLIs: { option-82 | access-line-id } parse-mode { binary | tr-101 | cn }
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The access-line-id parse-mode command can be used to configure an access-line-id information parsing mode on an interface based on the format of the access-line-id information sent from the downstream device.
The access-line-id information may be carried by DHCPv4 Option 82, DHCPv6 Options 18, 37, and 17, or a PPPoE+ option.
Prerequisites
Before running this command, set the access type of the user to layer2 subscriber, layer2-leased-line, or layer3 subscriber by the access-type command.
The access type of the user is set to layer2 subscriber, layer2-leased-line, or layer3 subscriber using the access-type command.
Precautions
This command is supported only on the admin VS.
The functions of the access-line-id parse-mode command and the option-82 parse-mode command are the same. Both of them are used to configure an access-line-id information parsing mode. If they have been both run more than once in the same view, the last configuration overrides the previous one.
